entries.english: Singular: Nĩ ngũ-ũka (I will come), Nĩ ngũ-rĩa (I will eat), Nĩ ngũ-kena (I will be happy), Nĩ ngũ-theka (I will laugh), Nĩ ngũ-thooma (I will read). Plural: Nĩ tũgũ-ũka (we will come), Nĩ tũkũ-rĩa (we will eat), Nĩ tũgũ-kena (we will be happy), Nĩ tũgũ-theka (we will laugh), Nĩ tũgũ-thooma (we will read)
entries.kikuyu: 1st Person Future Tense - Later Today (with Dahl's Law)

entries.english: Past (yesterday, -ire ending): Arĩngire kanua (made noise), Abogothire (mumbled), Athĩomire (spoke with accent), Ahayire (groaned), Akororire (snorted), Aathĩmũrire (sneezed), Aiguire kĩnyĩria (was disgusted), Ethĩkĩrire (sat sadly/mourned). Future (tomorrow, -ka- marker): Akarĩnga kanua (will make noise), Akabogotha (will mumble), Akathĩoma (will speak with accent), Akahaya (will groan), Akaathĩmũra (will sneeze), Akethĩkĩra (will mourn)
entries.kikuyu: Sound & Feeling Verbs - Past & Future Conjugation
